## 1. LocaleSwitcher Component Requirements

### 1.3 Behavioral Requirements (from Tests)

#### Test Suite: LocaleSwitcher.test.tsx

**Test Cases**:
- should render locale switcher with correct default value
- should render all available locales as options
- should display locale options in uppercase
- should have correct accessibility attributes
- should have correct CSS classes
- should handle locale change to French
- should handle locale change to Chinese
- should handle locale change with root pathname
- should handle locale change with nested pathname
- should work with different current locales
- should handle different locale configurations
- should refresh router after navigation
- should handle empty pathname correctly

**Expected Behaviors**:
- Test suite: LocaleSwitcher
- Expects: toBeDefined
- Expects: toBe
- Expects: toHaveLength
- Expects: toEqual
- Expects: toEqual
- Expects: toContain
- Expects: toContain
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledWith
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalled
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledWith
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalled
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledWith
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalled
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledWith
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalled
- Expects: toBe
- Expects: toHaveLength
- Expects: toEqual
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledBefore
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledTimes
- Expects: toHaveBeenCalledWith

### 1.4 Client Component Requirements

- Must include `'use client'` directive
- Can use React hooks and event handlers
- Must handle client-side state management
- Should implement proper error boundaries

### 1.5 Accessibility Requirements

- Must be keyboard navigable
- Must provide appropriate ARIA labels and roles
- Must support screen readers
- Must meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards

### 1.6 Performance Requirements

- Must minimize re-renders
- Should implement proper memoization where appropriate
- Must handle loading and error states gracefully
- Should support lazy loading if applicable

## 2. CounterForm Component Requirements

#### Test Suite: CounterForm.test.tsx

**Test Cases**:
- should render form with correct structure
- should have correct input attributes
- should call register function for input
- should handle form submission

### 3.3 Behavioral Requirements (from Tests)

#### Test Suite: Hero.test.tsx

**Test Cases**:
- renders the hero section correctly
- displays the hero subtitle
- renders feature badges with correct icons and text
- renders primary CTA button with correct link
- renders secondary CTA button with correct link
- displays statistics section
- renders hero image with correct attributes
- displays floating elements on hero image
- handles internationalization correctly
- applies correct CSS classes for styling
- renders without crashing when translations are missing
- has proper semantic structure
- has accessible image with proper alt text

**Expected Behaviors**:
- Test suite: Hero Component
- Expects: toBeInTheDocument
- Expects: toHaveAttribute
- Expects: toBeInTheDocument
- Expects: toHaveAttribute
- Expects: toBeInTheDocument
- Expects: toHaveAttribute
- Expects: toHaveAttribute
- Expects: toHaveClass
- Expects: toHaveClass
- Expects: toBeInTheDocument
- Expects: toBeInTheDocument
- Expects: toHaveLength
- Expects: toHaveAttribute

### 3.4 Client Component Requirements

- Must include `'use client'` directive
- Can use React hooks and event handlers
- Must handle client-side state management
- Should implement proper error boundaries

### 3.5 Accessibility Requirements

- Must be keyboard navigable
- Must provide appropriate ARIA labels and roles
- Must support screen readers
- Must meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards

### 3.6 Performance Requirements

- Must minimize re-renders
- Should implement proper memoization where appropriate
- Must handle loading and error states gracefully
- Should support lazy loading if applicable

- Can use React hooks and event handlers

### 13.3 Behavioral Requirements (from Tests)

#### Test Suite: BehaviorAnalyticsDashboard.test.tsx

**Test Cases**:
- renders container with authenticated user and displays all sections
- returns null when user is not authenticated
- displays loading states during data fetching
- handles and displays error states from API failures
- allows retry after error state
- renders with different time ranges selected
- renders metric cards with correct values, colors, trends, and click handlers
- supports keyboard navigation for metric cards
- displays pattern cards with strength indicators, frequency data, and triggers tracking on click
- displays empty state when no patterns are available
- displays analyzing state when isAnalyzing is true
- limits pattern cards to 6 items with proper slicing
- shows active status and last update time when real-time is enabled
- shows offline status when real-time is disabled
- passes correct props to chart components
- fetches initial data on component mount with correct API endpoints
- fetches data with different time ranges triggers appropriate API calls
- handles error when API endpoints return non-200 responses
- manages loading states correctly during sequential API calls
- updates state correctly when API responses are received
- enables automatic data refresh at specified refreshInterval
- stops real-time updates when component unmounts
- disables real-time updates when showRealTimeUpdates is false
- updates real-time indicator correctly with fetch status
- cleans up intervals on component unmount and prop changes

### 13.4 Client Component Requirements

- Must include `'use client'` directive
- Can use React hooks and event handlers
- Must handle client-side state management
- Should implement proper error boundaries

### 13.5 Accessibility Requirements

- Must be keyboard navigable
- Must provide appropriate ARIA labels and roles
- Must support screen readers
- Must meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards

- Must minimize re-renders
- Should implement proper memoization where appropriate
- Must handle loading and error states gracefully
- Should support lazy loading if applicable

## 14. BehaviorAnalyticsChart Component Requirements

### 14.1 Props Requirements

#### data Prop
- **Type**: `HabitStrengthData[] | ContextPatternData[] | BehaviorDataPoint[]`
- **Required**: Yes

#### chartType Prop
- **Type**: `"behavior_frequency" | "habit_strength" | "context_patterns" | "consistency_trends"`
- **Required**: No

#### title Prop
- **Type**: `string`
- **Required**: No

#### height Prop
- **Type**: `number`
- **Required**: No

#### width Prop
- **Type**: `string`
- **Required**: No

#### loading Prop
- **Type**: `boolean`
- **Required**: No

#### error Prop
- **Type**: `string`
- **Required**: No

#### className Prop
- **Type**: `string`
- **Required**: No

#### timeRange Prop
- **Type**: `"7d" | "30d" | "90d" | "1y"`
- **Required**: No

#### behaviorType Prop
- **Type**: `string`
- **Required**: No

#### showPrediction Prop
- **Type**: `boolean`
- **Required**: No

#### showConfidenceInterval Prop
- **Type**: `boolean`
- **Required**: No

#### onDataPointClick Prop
- **Type**: `(data: any) => void`
- **Required**: No

## Implementation Guidelines

### Component Development Standards
1. **Type Safety**: All components must be fully typed with TypeScript
2. **Error Boundaries**: Components should implement appropriate error boundaries
3. **Performance**: Components must meet performance requirements
4. **Accessibility**: All accessibility requirements must be met
5. **Testing**: Comprehensive test coverage is required
6. **Documentation**: Components must be properly documented

### Quality Assurance
1. **Code Review**: All component changes must undergo code review
2. **Testing**: All tests must pass before deployment
3. **Accessibility Audit**: Regular accessibility audits must be conducted
4. **Performance Monitoring**: Component performance must be monitored
5. **User Testing**: Components should undergo user testing when appropriate

This document serves as the definitive specification for component behavior requirements, extracted from comprehensive analysis of tests, stories, and TypeScript interfaces.
